titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2146) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow Federal law enforcement officers, firefighters, and air traffic controllers to make penalty-free withdrawals from governmental plans after age 50, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-167, by Mr. Sessions.
Resolution provides for consideration of the Senate amendment to H.R. 2146.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 43.

action.text: By direction of the Committeee on Rules, Mr. Sessions called up H.Res. 321 and asked for its immediate consideration.

POINT OF ORDER - Ms. Slaughter raised a point of order against the provisions of H.Res. 321 because it violates the Congressional Budget Act. The Chair announced that the disposition of the point of order would be resolved by the question of consideration on the resolution. The House proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the point of order at the end of which the Chair will put the question on consideration.
On consideration of the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 321.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 244 - 181 (Roll no. 373).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/17/2015--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2146) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow Federal law enforcement officers, firefighters, and air traffic controllers to make penalty-free withdrawals from governmental plans after age 50.
